narrative.title: 1St Greek Brigade - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: British Infantry Brigade (Free Greek Forces) deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: Free Greek infantry brigade integrated into British 8th Army. Combat-experienced after El Alamein and pursuit operations across Libya. Now deployed in Mareth Line defensive-offensive operations in Tunisia. Equipped with British weapons and organized along British lines. Proven in defensive operations; gaining offensive experience during pursuit phase. High morale despite supply constraints - Allied advance seen as step toward liberation of Greece.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Tunisian coastal plain and hills - mix of cultivated land, wadis, and rocky outcrops

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Combat-proven at El Alamein - no longer green troops
High morale - fighting to liberate occupied homeland
British-trained and equipped to Commonwealth standards
Experience in desert pursuit operations (Libya advance)
Strong unit cohesion among exile forces
Adaptable to both defensive and offensive roles

environment.terrain_type: Tunisian coastal plain and hills - mix of cultivated land, wadis, and rocky outcrops
